snippet: The convictions in Minnesota capped a two-year investigation and led to six other young men pleading guilty to terrorism charges.
abstract: Somali-Americans Guled Omar, Abdirahman Daud and Mohamed Farah, all of Minnesota, are convicted on federal charges of attempting to join Islamic State group in Syria; rulings highlight severity of problem of radicalization in Minnesota, largest Somali community in United States.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and MATT FURBER

lead_paragraph: The convictions in Minnesota capped a two-year investigation and led to six other young men pleading guilty to terrorism charges.

headline.main: 3 Somali-Americans Found Guilty of Trying to Join Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Convictions of 3 Linked to ISIS Put Community in a Spotlight

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
